See, the feature allows a Ryzen 5000-series processor to have full access to the GPU memory of a Radeon RX 6000-series GPU, which can have a decent impact on performance. That does sound smart, ha ha, but SAM is actually based on a technology called resizeable base address register, or resize BAR which has been a part of the PCIe spec for years. Nvidia has said they're working on adding the feature to their GPU as well. Some of the board makers have already released BIOS updates that enabled BAR on Intel's Z490 motherboards including Asus and ASRock, who named their implementation Clever Access Memory. Oh my God.
